text: Well located and rooms with enough Space. At breakfast Lizbeth, Mariana and Luis are always trying to help and have everything clean and ready! The kitchens at the rooms do not work very well but it wasnt a problem for us since we used the breakfast service at the lobby.

title: Excellent service
text: Can’t recommend this place enough. Truly friendly staff. Complete morning breakfast. The fridge and kitchenette is a life savor! Minutes from Penn, Port Authority, Times Square and the Javitz center!!!

title: Frequent Traveler
text:
Best part of this hotel is the staff. 
The doll at the counter w the big curly hair - Fabulous. 
Henry at the desk Fabulous. 
Even the Hilton Vacation Ambassadors - Very Nice. 
Everyone had great Customer Service. 

Breakfast - GOOD

Location - Good

A little outdated:
No USB ports in any of the rooms. 

Security out front would have made this 5 Star. 

Giving 4 stars because of this STAFF.

title: Great location
text: Very clean hotel beds are so comfortable staff very friendly breakfast every morning was great and having the kitchen was a brilliant bonus.   The hotel was in walking distance from all the sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Estupendo!
text:
Hemos quedado sorprendidos por la buena atención, pendientes en todo momento del cliente, de sus necesidades, gustos, etc

Estupendo trato de Félix, Elisabeth y en general de todo el hotel y maravillosa estancia. 
Muy limpio y ordenado.

title: Rip-off with the car service to JFK!
text: Don't take their car service to the airport JFK. Kareem promised me 85$ all included. I asked several times to confirm if it was really 85. At the airport the driver suddenly said it's 95$ plus tax. So we ended up paying 104.50$. Total rip-off!!! With Uber we would have paid 87$.

title: Decepcao
text:
Achei o quarto bem pequeno e sem vista nenhuma.
Camas muito moles sem conforto nenhum. A limpeza do quarto bem ruim, e 2 dias nao fizeram a limpeza e nem arrumacao da cama,
Cafe da manha sem mtas opcoes.

title: Cobrança indevida
text: Fiz a reserva pelo booking e após o check-out o hotel cobrou $1022,00 dólares do valor original da reserva. Estou tentando contato desde então, mas eles simplesmente não me dão uma explicação. Alegaram que no check-in cobram o valor de 7 diárias e depois as outras, porém esse valor extrapola o valor da reserva, que era de $3584,80 já com os impostos inclusos, a soma das cobranças deu $4607,20. O Hotel é bem localizado, quartos de tamanho bom para o padrão NYC, mas possuem alguns problemas com segurança, por duas vezes moradores de rua adentraram a recepção e nenhum funcionário tomou providências, eles falam que é proibido fumar, mas um dos quartos reservados estava com um cheiro insuportável.

title: Great stay
text: The Homewood team was fantastic and the accommodations for our family were great. The location in Midtown made Times Square and other areas very accessible by foot, and a much welcomed place to relax at the end of a long day. Lizbeth and the team at breakfast were very attentive and friendly. We look forward to staying here again when we return to NYC!

title: Immensely Happy!!
text: The structure is very comfortable, the service extraordinary and the human touch was amazing.  Especially the spanish speaking staff.  Thank you again for everything!!!  Will definitely be coming back!!!

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Great hotel, very clean and the breakfast options are lovely. Room was spotless and my daughter says the pullout bed was very comfortable. Our room was quite small, but I feel like that's par for the course in NYC. 

Had to wait for an elevator sometimes. And not much of a view even from the 22nd floor.

When we checked in, the staff member on the desk gave my daughter a Hershey's Bar. I thought this was a lovely welcome to NYC for a 7 year old on her first trip! Very quiet room as well.

title: Perfect city hotel
text: The breakfast is fantastic. Room was good size, has a mini kitchen, bed was comfortable and it was clean. No carpet so perfect for people with allergies. The gym was big and airy and had everything i needed. Also a laundry room if u need to catch up on that. I recall reading a post previously about drug users on the street but frankly speaking that is pretty much anywhere in Manhattan right now. And they were really no bother. Such good value. Keep it up Hilton

title: Awesome Place!
text: Breakfast was amazing! All the staff was so nice! I worked out and the gym was super clean, and overall am very impressed with how clean everything was. Felix and Lizbeth were so kind and helpful during breakfast!

title: Happy times
text: We love staying here when in NYC. So convenient to everything and breakfast very good. Especially Pedro who was so kind in taking care of breakfast guests needs. Thanks for a wonderful experience. Location is great. Travola down the street is very good.

title: Lovely stay at the heart of the city
text: Loved the stay in this hotel. The location was primo and the staff was really nice. The breakfast was filling with eggs, bagels , sausages and more. I’m really pleased with how clean and neat everything is. Lizbeth and Felix do an amazing job at keeping everything organized and flowing. Loved they care. Shout out to Giovanni that welcomed us. Definitely recommended it.

title: Home without the chores.
text: Homewood Suites is a place I came to love last year during a most trying time of my life. I was going through cancer treatment when I was displaced because of a fire. From the time of my arrival the staff helped me feel everything would be okay. Whatever need I had was addressed. The staff shared smiles and goodwill during every encounter.  The breakfast was appreciated be a use if you know anything about chemotherapy it affects what you can and can't eat. The variety of selects provided me with options. The business room allowed me to communicate with my insurance company and I was able to start the reconstruction of my home. I kept locking myself out my room,  they kept giving me a key to get back in my room. These are only a few reasons why I will always return to my home without chores.

title: Great find
text: Nice sized room especially for New York. Small 2 burner cooktop, microwave, frig and dishwasher make room functional and help defray costs of eating out.  Responsive staff.  Clean rooms.  Nice location.  Easy to access Time Square.  Gym is spacious and well equipped.  Breakfast is typical hotel breakfast.

title: Estadía en New York
text: Mi estadia fue muy agradable, las instalaciones y el personal muy buenos y confortables. He conocido a Felix, quien es una persona muy amable y del cual recibimos una gran atención. Una persona extremadamente servicial y dispuesta a que pases una gran estadía.

title: Excelente
text: El servicio que recibí durante mi estadía fue increíble, la atención por parte de todo el personal en especial de Amanda en el recepción fue muy buena, me sentí como en casa, siempre estuvieron con la mejor disposición para ayudarme con todo.

title: Excellent all round
text: Excellent hotel and excellent location.  The rooms were more spacious than I expected for a central city location and were equipped with a cooker, fridge freezer, microwave and coffee machine.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, special mention to Jennifer, Kareem and Miguel on the front desk and Lizabeth and Felix at breakfast.  They wee all very welcoming and service from everyone was excellent.  The bedrooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable.  We arrived on a Wednesday and it was so nice to be welcomed with a lovely buffet with soup, cheese and biscuits, fruit and more.  Breakfast was excellent with a good range of choice and the hot options changed daily.  Contant supply of tea, coffee and hot chocolate 24 hours in reception.Some previous reviews mentioned an issue with homeless we found no issues near the hotel. If I was to come back to New York I would definitely stay here again.  Thank you all for a fantastic base for an excellent stay in New York.

title: Great Hotel, good central location, clean and comfortable
text:
A great place to stay, facilities excellent. Rooms were clean and comfortable. 
Staff very friendly and helpful especially the restaurant staff Lizbeth and Felix.
Breakfast was excellent, good selection of food.
Felt safe in this hotel as it was an all girl holiday and had 3 teenagers.
Room freshened every day.

title: Everything we needed!
text: 4 night visit to NYC, staying at Homewood suites. Friendly reception staff, easy check in although $100 security deposit taken from credit card. Room 601 was a good size with large double bed, kitchenette with dishwasher microwave and fridge freezer. Free use of digital safe and good quality steam iron and board. Large TV with many channels with free and also PPV movies. Breakfast was cereals and pancakes with not much more options but it was all edible and good enough. If it is not raining or freezing cold there is a hidden gem on the roof. Take the lift to floor 22 and sit out on the roof terrace. Comfy seating and music, a lovely addition. The immediate vicinity surrounding the hotel is not great with some homeless but 30 secs walk and you are on 8th avenue with a short walk to times square. I would definitely stay here again if I return to NYC

title: New York City stay with friend.
text: It is a great hotel with exceptional employees who are all willing to help.  Felix, Lizbeth, Nicolas, Jennifer and Patty are the best in making your stay an awesome one.  Everything is near by with accesible mobility through Uber, Taxi or Trains.

title: Great Stay during Christmas in NYC
text: We really enjoyed this property.  The rooms are  clean, good size by NYC standards and well appointed.  The pull out bed was perfect for my little guy as was the breakfast.  We also took full advantage of the hot chocolate in the lobby! The staff were very kind and helped store our bags before check in.  The location is great.  Quieter neighborhood, but an easy walk to most anywhere you want to go.  The only slight complaint was the elevators wait times, but it was the holidays in NY- the place was a mad house, so it would be dumb to think the elevators would be quick.  Overall, highly recommend!

title: Servicio deficiente y no va de acuerdo a lo contratado
text: Se contrató una suite PREMIUM y nos dieron una habitación regular, se “perdieron” unis tennis en caja y bolsa nuevos y al reportarlos mágicamente aparecieron en la basura, se tardan demasiado en hacer el reembolso del deposito que solicitan, los elevadores están sucios y en general el personal de recepción ofrece mala cara al cliente

title: My first visit and stay at Homewood suites
text: This was my first time visiting a Homewood suites property, and I was very impressed. We were a group of three sister and a niece. We stayed over one night the room was very large, two queen size bed, kitchenette, and nice windows. We went down for breakfast and we encountered Elizabeth and Mariana are they were great. although it was a little busy, they were very helpful and professional. Also, the manager was on hand for most of the day, which is unusual to actually see the managers out working all day in a hotel, and the breakfast selections were great by the way, I usually see a different properties and this place definitely had a better selection of breakfast foods

title: bene ma non benissimo
text:
struttura carina abbastanza comoda per raggiungere le maggiore attrazioni a piedi, stazione della metro penn station a pochi metri.
colazione buona ma molto affollata a e con pochi posti a sedere.
camere carine anche se un po piccole

title: Not recommended
text: We stayed 14 seats at your hotel. First 11 days there was no heater working at our room. We only realized that on the 28th when all of us got sick and had to call 911 and went to the hospital. My fever was 106 and my body was dehydrated due to the no heat at the room. We were at the hospital whole night and came next day afternoon. Since 28th we couldn't go out and our whole trip was wasted. We couldn't go and see the ball drop which we came to see. My husband had to go to hospital again. After we complained they came and check the room and realized the heater was not working. They changed our room on the 01st. 3 days before our checkouts. But then it was too late. Manager promised me that they will Credit back  $650 to my credit card which never happened. Since we complained about the   Room heater the front desk staff were very rude to us. We paid $ 2800 to the Airline & about $5000 for your hotel to have a pleasant stay. Our whole trip to New York was ruined. Never expected that from Hilton. As soon as we returned to California my husband got admitted at the Hollycross hospital. He is having Pneumonia and Asthma. Because there was no heater working at the hotel room. He is still at the hospital. My ears are still blocked and I still have Cough and fever. My Son also went to hospital in New York and got treatments for ears blocked. He still has that. I will speak to my lawyer about this. Because it's hotel duty and responsibility to check the heating and air conditioning before the guests arrive.

title: Buon rapporto qualità prezzo
text: Hotel vicino a time Square e a molte attrazioni di New York, camere moderne con parquet cucina microonde, lavastoviglie e possibilità di aprire un po' la finestra. Bagno con doccia ampia. Personale gentile e pronto a soddisfare ogni esigenza. Noi siamo stati 6 e avrebbero rifatto la camera solo 4 volte, quando al check in mi hanno visto un po' perplessa mi hanno detto che la camera potevano anche farla ogni giorno. Colazione compresa nel prezzo sia calda che non con la possibilità di portare via qualcosa dato che ci sono le scatole di carta apposite. Unica mancanza sono gli affettati e e i formaggi. Tre ascensori troppo lenti, soprattutto il sabato mattina con le valigie abbiamo aspettato quasi 10 minuti per scendere perché non arrivano o erano pieni. Consiglio questo hotel per il rapporto qualità prezzo, soprattutto perché si ha la colazione e la possibilità di cucinare dato i prezzi altissimi che ha New York ora.

title: Bajaron demasiado el nivel, pobre para ser Hilton
text: El hombre afroamericano de la noche con el tatuaje en el brazo izquierdo muy asqueroso, no te quieren dar monedas para el servicio de lavanderia y las habitaciones muy pobres en calidad. No dan papel ni toallas. Limpieza mala. El desayuno bajo de calidad pero es bueno al igual que la cafeteria. El gimnasio basico pero sirve. El hombre latino de la noche un fenomeno y Jennifer resolutiva.

title: NYC January 2023
text:
Wonderful place, we arrived early and we were able to have an early check in for free. 

 Thanks to Gio/Amanda. Very nice location near to time square , Central Park and others.

No problem for the parking also, they were very quick to answer my email.

title: Muy buena opción para hospedarse en familia
text: Muy bueno para hospedarse en familia. La ubicación es perfecta y el desayuno buenisimo, super completo. El servicio es excelente todo el personal se esfuerza por hacerte sentir como en tu casa. Mis felicitaciones  a Felix y al equipo.

title: Amazing experience
text:
Excellent service from beginning to end.
Breakfast, room, ancillary services and all the rest
Very polite and easy going personnel. Very congrats to Felix, always smiling and ready to support during breakfast!

title: Vacaciones
text:
Felix and lizbeth excelente servicio, recomendado. El desayuno excelente, al igual que el personal, muy seguro y cerca de todo. Agradecidos por todas sus atenciones. Aparte de
Todo excelente súper, ok

title: NAVIDADES EN  NYC
text:
Vamos a empezar con lo mejor: 
1. Nuestra habitación, para 5 , era espaciosa, dos camas grandes y un sofá cama, este ultimo no muy cómodo pero pedimos un colchón extra y nos lo subieron sin problemas, por lo que asunto arreglado.     
2. El mirador del piso 22 una gozada y muy tranquilo , supongo que con buen tempo estará mas concurrido. 
3. La variedad y cantidad del desayuno
4. La disponibilidad H24 de café, te y cola cao en recepción
5. El Gym tambnien H24 mas que suficiente 
6. Lavandería y sala de ordenadores 
7. El personal , encantador 
8. La ubicacion : a 10 m andando de Times Square  
lo que menos : 
1. el baño , muy viejo , pequeño 
2. la limpieza al llegar y durante los días alojados ( hay que pedirla expresamente) podría ser mejor 
3. los ascensores, pero supongo que es porque había uno de tres roto y mucha mucha gente        

el balance en general en bastante  positivo y creo que para ir en familia es bastante adecuado

title: New Year’s Eve trip to NYC
text: My wife and I traveled to NYC for the nye weekend to see our favorite band play at Madison square garden. Couldn’t be happier with our decision. We were greeted at the front desk by Henry who helped us check in and answered all the questions we had. Hotel was a short 5 min walk from the venue and a good base to explore the city. We especially enjoyed the Hudson yards area with its amazing architecture. The room was spacious and had everything we needed including a kitchen with refrigerator. Other hotel workers that helped make our stay enjoyable were Amanda, Omar, Gio, and Zune. Thanks for everything!!! We will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

title: Regular.
text:
Estuve hace poco en este hotel. Decidimos pasar navidad en NY. 
Para empezar que la atención siempre fue muy cordial y correcta pero hay mucho que objetar debido a que se hacen llamar "by Hilton". El hotel cuenta con 20 pisos y 3 ascensores, aproximadamente entre10 y 15 habitaciones por piso por lo que el transito de sube y baja siempre es complicado a esto sumarle que estuvimos una semana completa sin 1 ascensor por lo que fue caótico. Perdíamos entre 10 y 15 minutos cada mañana para salir. Increíble!!
Otro defecto es el poco espacio que hay en el desayunador, estuvo siempre colapsado, sin mesas disponibles y con gente comiendo por el lobby del hotel... nunca visto. 
Respecto a las habitaciones, en nuestro caso personal, mucho mas pequeña de lo que se ve en las fotos de promoción.
La limpieza fue nula aunque si nos cambiaron y suministraron a diario las toallas y los productos de higiene personal. 
Lo mejor del hotel es sin duda la ubicación aunque no se si volvería.

title: Amazing stay for New Year  and Christmas break in the NYC
text: I was there for New Year  and Christmas holidays.The staff was amazing even Maria from Grand Vacation was so,so helpful .My daughter got sick she searched for cold medicine and closes pharmacy.She checked on her almost every day while our stay.Maria described all the Hilton group hotels even helped me to plan my next trip to Myrtle beach .The front desk people was so friendly and helpful .I had two young associates they were in their early twenties but this two amazing young men and woman almost managed all the issues with smiley face.Giovani and Nneoma I appreciated you both .It was very close to new year eve .I wasn’t happy with my previous hotel and left them .I had no other place to stay.This young people tried their best to find me a room with best prices.They worked as a great team and booked me very quickly,nice unite with kitchen in it.We were exhausted with my family .They recognized that and let us to check in earliest time.Giovani and Nneoma needs to be manager their because they were 15 people behind me on the line .Those two associates cleaned that line in 15 minutes.Everybody was happy with their service.Also I would like to upgrade my room next day it was very easy process with them again.Amazing to see them with wonderful performance and great customer service experience in very young age.The breakfast was excellent.Their was crowd people .I recognized Feliz running around cleaning the table and welcoming the customers and he was making sure find everyone  rooms.it was self service but Helping the old people to carry their food .Sanitizing everywhere before he was making them to sitting around of table.Same Feliz was also helping room service with his smile.He was working instead of three people and helping his team also with smile.We had broken tv and called front desk .The technicians were also so professional.I stayed there 12/29 /2022 to 01/01/2023 .I do not remember the technician name but he was great because also he fixed the dryer in the laundry room in minutes to help me out .I do not know his name but I appreciated him do much .From grand vacations AT was a great guy too.Very clean place ,the rooms are with kitchenette.room service was great always we had fresh towels and they changed our bed sheets.Taking care of garbage and sanitizing the bathrooms.I am looking forward to come back and stay there again next month for my business trip .

title: Preis-Leistung Top!!!
text:
Klasse Hotel in guter Lage. Das beschreibt eigentlich schon das Wichtigste. 
Große U-bahn Stationen sind direkt drumherum. Man kann zu Fuß zu einigen Hotspots gehen. Genügend Restaurants und Delia direkt ums Eck. 
Die Zimmer sind super, perfekte Größe mit Kochnische und einer kleinen Sitzgruppe. Das Bad ist recht groß. Alles war sauber und ansprechend. 
Der Checkin ging superschnell und das Personal war generell sehr freundlich. Der Service war hier top. Egal ob man einen Tip  oder Hilfe brauchte, jeder war freundlich und hat sich direkt gekümmert. 
Das Frühstücksbuffet bietet jedem was, frisches Obst, Müsli, ein warmes Buffet mit French Toast, Eier, Würstchen und und und. 
Wir würden immer wieder kommen.

title: NYE
text: June and the staff were great! From check-in to check-out, the team was courteous and friendly. The hotel was clean, quiet, and housekeeping was prompt daily. We will certainly be back for Phish when the play the Garden.

title: FLAWLESS HOTEL FOR HOLIDAYS
text: This was the first time that I stayed at this tel and everything was absolutely perfect. The thing that stood out the most was the attention given by all of the the staff. The way that all staff members greeted me and my family, the way that everyone worked so hard to keep everything so clean and just how helpful every was for ever aspect of our stay. Though everyone we encountered provided excellent service. There were several staff members that went above and beyond, those people were Iris, Samir and Amanda who was truly the Rock Star of the property.

title: Buen servicio y excelente ubicación
text: Excelente ubicación. Buen servicio y personal súper atento. Queremos agradecer especialmente a Félix y Lizbeth (personal durante el desayuno) la atención que han tenido con nosotros durante toda nuestra estancia.

title: Vacaciones de Navidad
text:
Excelentes facilidades, maravillosa asistencia por parte de los empleados, hacen que uno se sienta en familia (Félix, Jennifer, Don Pedro María entre otros).
Desayuno bufet, alimentos preparados todos los días. Café, chocolate y té disponible 24 hrs.

title: Vacaciones de navidad
text: Todo excelente, desde el recibimiento con Jennifer y la cafetería con Félix. Todo en él área que bien céntrico. Seguro para caminar a toda hora. Las facilidades siempre limpias, refrescan a diario las habitaciones.

title: Disappointed
text: I was disappointed with check in. We called ahead as Hilton Honors Diamond Members and asked could we have early check-in. Due to them being full we could not. That was understandable but we were told to pre check in and we could most likely be in by 3 pm which is before the 4 pm check in time. We pre checked in around 2 pm, walked the City, returned at 4 pm to relax and our room was not ready until after 5 pm. The elevators are also a major issue with the volume and one was broke. They were jammed packed as well which was uncomfortable. I suggest a lower level room where you can walk the stairs

title: Felix was amazing
text: Feliz from house keeping was great. He helped us with everything we needed. He answered all of our questions. He even provided us with more towels. I will be coming back because of the help he provided. Thanks felix.

title: Great food for your stay
text: Excellent service from Felix, who works in the kitchen. He kept everything clean, was always at the top level of work. Highly recommended for his hard work ethic and great attitude towards other employees and hotel guests.

title: Hidden Gem of a Hotel on West 37th Street New York
text:
We stayed at Homewood suites by Hilton on W37th from 15th December to 21st December 2022 and cannot reccommend it highly enough.

We had a corner suite that had a large bed and sofa bed with a small kitchen that contained a fridge, dishwasher, coffee maker, microwave, hob and sink.  There was also crockery and cutlery.  Although we were on the 5th floor, we didn’t hear a lot of noise from the street outside apart from the bin men and sirens, but you hear them everywhere in New York.

The beds are very large and comfortable, there is a good tv and the hotel has free wi-fi for guests.  They also include breakfast in the rate & there are hot drinks available in reception all day, which was very welcome after a day of sightseeing in the cold.

The staff at this hotel are really good, Mandy on reception knows all the residents and is quick to check if there is someone she is not sure about. The breakfast staff keep the area clean and tidy and although sometimes there is a bit of a wait for tables at breakfast it’s never that long and the food is very good, with fresh muffins, fruit, eggs, bacon etc which definitely saves you a lot of money in New York.

The location on W37th is very good for local shops.  There is Brooklyn Fayre very nearby which provides very good fresh food.  At the top of the street on 9th Avenue is Vito’s Slices and Ices which does great pizza, even gluten free which was delicious.  Macy’s is also very close as are lots of other bars and restaurants.

title: Amazing stay with my daughter
text: The hotel was beautiful nice and clean and closed to touristy areas, and subway station. Free coffee station 24/24.  Idris ,Samir and Henry they were also helpful all time with directions. I also get a free early checking. Thanks again

title: Not really convenient, not really Hilton quality, not really value for money.
text: It certainly isn't quality. Booked a studio for 3 adults and gosh was it small. The sofa bed is of horrendous quality, as it is simply an old piece of foam wrapped in bed sheet, and it threatened to disintegrate further as I was pulling it out. Other than this it was a really at most 4 star hotel and does the basics well, in terms of cleanliness and all.

title: Would definitely return to this hotel!
text: Mahliek, Jennifer, and Amen, they were all so helpful every time we needed directions, sheets, snacks etc! Very nice and understanding. Hotel was clean and nice. Very safe as well keys are needed to get to the stairs etc. Anyone who’s not allowed/ not staying at the hotel was removed. Breakfast was good. Beds were very comfortable and clean! If I ever traveled to New York, would definitely be staying at this hotel again.

title: Amazing customer service, and nice rooms/kitchen!
text: I planned a trip with my boyfriend to go to New York to see a Broadway play for my first time. I found this hotel that was walking distance to the theaters and even had a kitchen. After booking our play, we started looking at a second play and decided to book a second night. Since I had booked it with advanced purchases, I figured I’d just. lol the second night the same way since I couldn’t change my current stay for night 1. I accidentally clicked on the wrong tab and booked a night for the hotel next door. Both hotels looked amazing from my searches I made, but we had decided to go with this hotel simply because of the kitchen. Once we arrived, I then realized I had booked the second night at the hotel next door. Later that day I went to the front desk to see if there was anything they could do since my second night was next door but also at a Hilton hotel. I was told because I booked it as an advanced purchase, it made it harder to switch. The GM, sent an email the the GM at the Garden Inn next door and was able to get it switched for me. Our stay was very comfortable. I loved having a kitchen so we didn’t have to eat out every night. We brought some food and made it in our room. And with how close it was to everything, we were able to walk most places. The breakfast Ott mornings were really good. I have a gluten allergy, and I was still able to eat enough to be full. We will come back again next trip to New York!!

title: Amazing!
text: The hotel was very beautiful, and was close to touristy areas. The breakfast had so many options, and it all tasted delicious. There was even access to free hot chocolate and coffee at any time too! The only complaint I have was that the elevators were occasionally slow, but there were stairs options too. Would definitely go back.

title: Accommodating Experience
text: I had an extremely pleasant experience at the front desk with Giovanni. He was very pleasant, helpful and professional but most importantly he was super efficient. During my dining experience I met Lizbeth and Felix and they went out of their way to help my family with comfortable seating, food, drinks and cleanliness. All three definitely made my experience much more pleasant. I recommend looking for these during your stay.

title: Great Hotel, Great staff and VERY clean indeed!
text: This hotel has a great location! Easy access to subway, train and bus. Close to many major attractions and landmarks in NYC. This was one of the cleanest hotels we have ever visited and the staff worked tirelessly to keep it clean. There is a great complementary hot breakfast included with your stay and Lizbeth, Jefferson, and Padro worked tirelessly to keep the food available, hot, and delicious! They also maintained the dining area in an exemplary manner and kept it clean. They were friendly, helpful, and genuinely concerned with doing a great job and we appreciated their efforts very much. We would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Our visit was awesome
text:
Feliz and Lizbeth were wonderful! Very attentive and polite!
Location, location!!!!! Everything was wonderful!
Thank you so much! Clean and efficient!
Good size of rooms for NYC!!!!! We highly recommend this hotel! Breakfast was good as well! Thank you very much for everything!

title: Perfect family time in New York City
text:
Felix Lizbeth has been so wonderful person to be around for fine dining experience in the property 
Kids were so happy and wanted to give 10/10 for his hospitality 
Overall very nice experience to enjoy our holidays in the city

title: Broadway show
text: Overall, it was a good experience. Room was clean.  Breakfast was just okay. The weather the night we were there was cold and crappy so we couldn’t use the rooftop but it looked nice.  Parking was available on the same block which was nice. I just wish the parking had been a little less expensive. But other than that, we had a great time.

title: For the Stay
text: The Hotel staff in the breakfast area is very very very amazing! I would especially like to shout out Ana, Jefferson, Luis (I believe he was the houseman) and Mariana (I really liked her glasses). xox

title: Hospitality A+!! Staff are outstanding !
text: Hospitality A+!! Many thanks for making our short friends trip so memorable! Special shout out to Henry @ Front Desk for being so friendly , accommodating and going over and beyond for us🤗 your warm smile and adorable Santa hats won’t be forgotten! Thank you Manager Kareem for making sure we were taken care of (yes we were thanks to Henry!) Lastly, special thanks to Nicolas, Lobby houseman, for finding my iPhone and returning to front desk for safe keeping. SOOO appreciated!! Despite miserable weather, the  staff definitely made  our NYC visit cozy and warm.  We will be back !! Merry Christmas 🎄

title: Family visit to NYC
text: The hotel was magnificent.  Room was very spacious and had everything you would need in the kitchenette.  Breakfast every day was delicious and many options each day.  Had a good conversation with Alex about just general topics with traveling.  Lizbeth and all of the staff made it a comfortable stay.

title: Genial
text: Nos resultó excelente por ubicación, desayuno y cocina en la habitación. El personal es muy atento. Muchos hablan español. Muy genios Felix y Pedro en el desayuno y las chicas de limpieza de la habitación.

title: December 2-6, 2022 Family visit to NYC
text: Our stay at this hotel was nothing but positive, from the friendly and efficient check in through our departure. Great staff, confortable rooms, free breakfast with lots of variety, all day coffee and tea!!  We loved the central walkable location and felt very safe coming and going from the hotel.  The rooms and bedding were extremely comfortable and we made use of the super pull out sofas for the extra beds in the family rooms we booked, and that worked out very well. All in all can’t say enough good things about this stay. The manager Jonathan was especially accommodating for our large family group (part of which arrived frim Europe and we were able to get an early check in for them) - many thanks all around !!!!

title: Not a great experience - Better places around for better value
text: I checked in using the Hilton App to get my digital keys and was surprised to get a accessible room which wasn't disclosed on the app. The hotel was busy so perhaps it was the only room available and I was checking in late so didn't ask to change, but was disappointing since I was paying an ungodly sum of money for the room (North of $700.00) because of availability in the city. What was probably worse was the room was not that clean. The floor (wood flooring) was sticky in many areas, and just generally didn't feel clean. The TV also had a large black circle show up after the TV turned on making watching TV pretty much unusable. I also had to iron a shirt which they give you one of those mini ironing boards you have to put on the bed to use which to me is useless. Hate hotels that do that. The stretch of the block it is on is also not a great location. I had to leave early in the morning so checked out using the app again. Who knows if the staff could have fixed things but there was always a line at the front desk. Long and short, I would not come back as I believe you can find something better 99% of the time for a lot less in better location and cleaner.More

title: Great hotel great location
text:
Great breakfast, Elizabeth,Felix, in  the breakfast  Miguel Briones, were outstanding with the services they provided.
Only extra service they could add is to make sure the room should be replenished of the coffee items and garabages emptied everyday

title: Great Customer Service
text: From the time we arrived we have been greeted and helped by a professional and friendly staff. Check in was quick and we were able to drop off our luggage the morning of check in so we could enjoy a full day in the city without worry. The room is spacious and clean. Thank goodness, no carpet! Breakfast was very good and fully stocked. I love the to-go boxes that you can take back to the room. Lizbeth and Felix were so kind and quick to make sure I had everything I needed to feed my family. We have found our base camp for when we visit NYC! Such a WONDERFUL CITY!!

title: Buen servicio
text:
El servicio de Félix y Lizbeth en el comedor es buenísimo, amable, atentos.
Hotel muy recomendable, habitaciónes limpias y amplias. Zona tranquila 
Hotel muy céntrico con estaciones de metro y autobús cerca.

title: Servicio de Félix y Lizbeth
text:
Nos trataron perfectamente durante nuestra estancia en el hotel. Estaban atentos a cualquier necesidad que tuviéramos y siempre solucionando nuestras dudas
Les mandamos un saludo y esperemos que le vaya todo bien

title: Nice hotel, centrally located, terrible block
text: The hotel is nice and centrally located.  I chose a room on the 18th floor and could not hear any sirens or car horns.  The rooftop is awesome if you are looking for a place to hang out.  Unfortunately, the hotel is located in the garment district and a lot of the shops close early in the evening, leaving the street dark.  Therefore it attracts a lot of mentally ill homeless people and drug users.  Be prepared to see men smoking crack and defecating in the street.  I realize it’s NYC, but  we were harassed coming and going to the hotel just 40 ft from the front door.  The hotel will say the have “called the police”, but the police don’t arrest anybody in NY anymore.  They need to do more to protect the property and keep their guests safe.  The hotel would be 5 stars if not for this and it is an issue.

title: Amazing customer service!
text: We were so impressed with the front desk customer service. They were quick to respond to our questions and were very helpful with storage of our luggage for the day!  I would highly recommended a stay at Homewood Suites! The only negative, no bar. After an extremely busy day with my grandchildren, I would have loved a mixed drink.

title: My NYC experience
text:
Loved the Hotel, and it being in the center of Manhattan was exceptional! Clean room, comfortable cozy bed, sanitized and clean smelling bathroom.  
The breakfast was so delicious!! I want to recommend and recognize Ana, Lizbeth and Jefferson for a job very well done. This was my very first time in NYC and I loved it! After walking and enjoying the city it was wonderful to get a great night sleep, in Homewood Suites, NYC

title: Great location. GREAT, helpful staff.
text: From the initial welcome to the smiling faces and helpful staff, we enjoyed our stay here. GREWAT location close to SO many things we wanted to see. I would strongly recommend this property and will stay here when we return to NYC.

title: Nice stay
text: Enjoyed our stay here in December 2022.    All the staff were so polite and helpful, especially June.  Felt very safe at all times. Quite on the 10th floor, work out facility nice and clean. Will stay here again. Thank you

title: Hotel espectacular
text: Estadía y atención de primera en especial de Jenifer, Gio, Idris y Cyndi , El lugar de excelente ubicación, el personal de primera , sólo agregaría alguna variedad de fiambres al desayunar pero la realidad que el servicio del mismo es muy bueno

title: Just not good enough
text: Good location and this is all there is to it. Everything else is average. The price is a bit high. Walls are paper thin. Don't expect the room to be cleaned even if you ask for it. This is one of the Homewood Suites that is below par. Also, evening reception is now only once a week.

title: Great stay!!
text: Truly great stay at a fantastic hotel!!  If you are going to Madison Square Garden this is the place to stay. Only a few blocks away, surrounded by restaurants, shops and bars the hotel itself was incredibly clean and incredibly quiet for a city hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Thanksgiving In New York
text: We came to New York to see the Macy’s Thanksgiving day parade. The hotel was great and only a few blocks away from the parade route. The customer service was excellent and the room was what you would expect in New York City. On the last day the staff was excellent, they held our bags for a few extra hours after we checked out so we could explore the city around the hotel. Once done, we made our way to Penn Station and then took the train home.

title: Just stay here
text: Don't look any further- just book here.  Laundry self service or hotel service, kitchens, awesome breakfast, and close to everything (37th and 8th).  You can't beat the value.  Thank you Alex for signing us up for the Hilton Vacation club.  Most importantly, thank you to the food and beverage and housekeeping staff.  You all are amazing!

title: Great
text: Awesome place.  Pedro and Anna took care of us.  Would stay again.  Clean quiet good location. We would definitely come back to the Homewood suites if we're staying in Manhattan and we think this chain is an excellent choice. Make sure to ask for Pedro and Anna to take good care of you

title: Hotel perto daTimes Square
text: A estrutura do hotel é muito boa e espaçosa. Quartos novos e amplos, com café da manhã (muito bem servido), academia e lavanderia. O serviço é muito atencioso e os funcionários muito educados. Perto da penn station e da times square. Na quarta-feira eles oferecem um “brunch” no final do dia.

title: Truly Amazing Stay
text: My three week stay was wonderful with clean rooms, outstanding front desk, engineering,house cleaning, and breakfast and reception.  Idris, Henry, Sebastian, Marco, Lisbeth, Jennifer, Mariana, Pedro, Luis, Ana, Jefson, & everyone else contributed to the amazing stay!  All needs and requests were attended to immediately.  Extraordinary hot breakfast and reception.  MAHALO!

title: Felicidades
text:
Quiero felicitar a todo el personal del hotel por su amabilidad y buen servicio. En especial quiero mencionar y agradecer a Nico, Pedro, Mariana y Félix por la excelente atención que tuvieron con nosotros en toda nuestra estadía. Muchas gracias por todo. 

Camila y Diego, Chile.

title: Super hôtel
text: Hôtel très agréable et stratégique pour les visites . Métro aux portes de l’ hôtel . Chambre spacieuse un plus sur Manhattan. Petite kitchenette qui permet de cuisiner un encas . Machine à café à the , frigo microonde . Literie très agréable . Petit déjeuner classique et  correct qui permet de se rassasier avant la journée . Café et thé à volonté la journée .  Je conseille cet hôtel

title: Estadia durante a Maratona de NY 2022
text: Gostaria de deixar aqui nesta avaliação o que achei de pior em minha estadia de 7 dias. Os funcionários são extremamente mal humorados e as solicitações são simplesmente ignoradas.O hotel fica em uma rua cheia de viciados e, se torna assustador andar de noite na rua. O quarto é bom, bem equipado. O ponto fraco são os funcionários mesmo

title: Hotel très bon rapport qualité/prix
text:
Hotel très bien situé pour visiter New York. 
A proximité de Time Square, Madison et du métro  ( tout ça à  5 min à  pied).
Très bon accueil et personnel très gentil ( par contre ne parle pas français sauf une personne présente le matin).
Chambre agréable et calme  la kitchenette est un vrai plus.
Grand lit confortable , nous avions un canapé lit pour notre fils de 17 ans, plus par contre un lit d'appoint pour enfant que pour grand adolescent mais finalement parés de longue marche a fait 
Présence certes à proximité de drogués mais finalement comme à beaucoup d'endroit à New York ils font partie du paysage malheureusement mais sans aucun sentiment d'insécurité même tard le soir.
Je recommande vivement cet hôtel.

title: Good Hotel Times Square
text:
This is just a good hotel in NYC.  Rooms were clean and quiet.  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  Met all our needs!  Breakfast was great and good variety. I'd like to thank for going above and beyond of the staff in particular,
Henry at the front desk and Pedro.  
If ever visiting NYC again, will definitely stay.

title: Good hotel, good location
text:
The room was spacious, with everything you need, including a small kitchen, a microwave and a big refrigerator. There was even an ironing board and an iron. Breakfast was good: coffee, tea, milk, juice, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, eggs, cereals and more. The staff was friendly and very efficient, especially Felix. The location is also great, close to the subway and walking distance from many touristic attractions. The staff at the reception as well as the housekeepers were also very friendly. 

The beds were a bit too soft, probably because of the many guests using them. Maybe they should replace the mattresses at some point. The TV didn’t work. We mentioned it at the reception, but nobody repaired it. Not that we had much time to watch tv, but it would have been nice to watch (and listen to) American tv for a few minutes.

The only "negative" thing was already mentioned by other guests and hasn‘t really anything to do with the hotel itself: outside the hotel, on the very same street and also around the corner on 8th Av , there are several homeless people and drug addicts who take the (hard) drugs just there.

title: Simply a great hotel!
text: This is just a great all around hotel. Quiet, comfortable, clean, updated. The staff is awesome. The crew that runs this place act like they own it. They have all been very efficient and over the top with extra touches you would never expect. Main thing, we all slept great!

title: A gem in a mad city
text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From start to finish the staff are the friendliest I've ever encountered. The hotel was lovely. Rooms great, clean and kitchenette was a god send. The little touches like leaving sweets out for the kids on Halloween and a best pumpkin competition to vote on. Breakfast free for all guests was lovely and they provided take away boxes for people to take extra for picnics or whatever. Situated right on the centre of everything east to walk to or subway close by will get you everywhere else.

title: Good hotel . We would recommend it.
text: We thought this hotel was very good. Great location. Great rooms and room service was excellent. Breakfast was fine. Nothing special but it’s a bonus to have breakfast included in price . I didn’t get the same feeling about the customer service . It was fairly average but we didn’t go there for customer service we wanted a good location , comfortable room and reasonable breakfast and it ticked all those boxes . Yes there are homeless outside. They don’t interfere with anyone . It is just sad to see so many people all over New York who are homeless and taking weed and shooting up. Yes they are outside the hotel but they are everywhere . You won’t escape it .

title: Excelente hotel y plantilla
text: Te sientes como en casa,el personal te intenta facilitar cualquier cosa ,la cama es muy muy cómoda.Un aspecto a mejorar sería la variedad en el desayuno.El hotel no tiene culpa q en la calle en ocasiones hay personas sin techo.

title: Better than expected, depends what you value!
text:
This is not a perfect luxury hotel but it gets so, so much right. I would consider staying again, especially with tweenies. It all depends on your priorities, we did a lot of research and Homewood Suites Manhattan turned out to be a great choice for us.

The good: 
Clean, comfortable, friendly professional staff, decent air quality, roomy room for Manhattan, central location in Midtown, walking distance to Penn Station, subway, Times Square and Broadway. 
Rooms have big fridge, small freezer, good dishbasher, good TV and good seating area with pull-out table in the room. You could save so much money cooking meals for yourselves and/or getting takeout to the room, very suitable for families with younger/fussy/allergic children. 
Never used coffee maker as no coffe pods in our room, only tea bags, maybe you buy them, I don't know. But there is free coffe/tea/hot chocolate available in the lobby all day.
Generous breakfast, taking fruit and pastries with you is totally fine, there's even boxes for it. 
We did a batch of laundry in the basement on our 4th day, cost about $10 (got change for the automats from reception), great, kids enjoyed helping. Didn't use gym but looked good. 
9th ave is just around the corner wich is far better for food and corner shops ie more local quality places. We especially enjoyed Vito's Slices & Ices a short walk away, got takeout from them twice and ate in once at a small counter table at the back once. Laid back and delicious pizza, best NYC slice I've had. 
Sushi Star also fantastic, not the cheapest but amazing quality run by hard working family and heaving with locals. Had our favourite Unagi sushi (grilled eel) and other goodies, worth every penny.
We got some lovely prosecco from Amster Wine and toasted on the hotel roof terrace. Amazing gourmet "supermarket" shopping at Brooklyn Fare a few minutes walk away. The deli items there looked fantastic, we wandered around this meticulous higgeldy-piggeldy  "supermarket" (with a hidden michelin restaurant in the middle!) for an hour! Bought snacks, fun drinks and things here. 
Did some browsing at new shopping centre Hudson Yard at about 15 mins walking distance, very polished and nice and there's a Shake Shack. You can also get on the High Line from there. 
Our favourite local restaurant was Ben's Kosher Deli 209 W 38th St, 10 mins walk, visited twice. Kids loved the burgers & fries, we loved the pastrami sandwich & chicken soup, prefer it to over hyped NY kosher delis like Katz's.
Please note: Manhattan is a VERY expensive place and tipping staff generously is the norm, ie 20% + , pref in cash.

The less good:
Wednesday afternoons/early evenings there's apparently free soup, cheese and crackers and cookies served in the lobby. Would have been great if we were told this at check-in so we hadn't missed out.
Yes the fridge is loud. I pulled out and unplugged mine. Otherwiswe good sleep quality. The tap water doesn't taste good. There's a filtered water machine is in the gym in the basement, we filled up our bottles daily. 
Breakfast isn't gourmet and things run out and it's very busy, but we always ate well and varied, and managed to find a table for four after a bit of waiting each morning. 
Midtown isn't the prettiest part of Manhattan and yes there is an addiction clinic on the same street as the hotel, resulting in a number of vulnerable people just outside and on the way to the nearest subway station. If you or your children have never experienced closeness to vulnerable people this may come as a shock, but we never felt threatened and were never approached.

title: Could do much better
text: Hotel well located in Manhattan. Unfriendly reception and staff. Correct breakfast without more. House keeping was absolutely minimalist or even non-existent unless you make the request... sometimes repeated at the reception to get the minimum. The fridge in the room was also veryb noisy overnight. We do expect better for this type of hotel and at this price. Too bad!

title: Wow
text: We were a few minutes late at check in and I went to see the breakfast area. As I approached, I was warmly greeted by Lizbeth,a sweet young lady working in the area. She immediately asked how she could help and then brought me a plate, utensils and led me to the area that she was putting food away for the day. She then asked if I would like some fruit for later. Three cheers for Lizbeth. Homewood Suites is lucky to have her! She is wonderful.

title: Voyage New-York
text: Incroyable,  l'hôtel est très bien situé,  prés de Times Square et de nombreuses activités, métro à proximité.  Petit déjeuner copieux à volonté, personnel très sympathique et disponible. Très bonne expérience

title: Quite disappointed
text:
I booked this room over many other options after reading so many good reviews. 
I will just say what was good and what was bad.

Good: Location. Very close to subway and Madison Square Garden.
The room was clean. The ac was cold (it was in the 60’s in the city this weekend so it was nice out. You could open your window slightly for fresh air which was also nice. 
We were allowed a late check out (1 pm) and an 8:30 pm flight and they held our bags. So that was great!

Bad: Location, homeless and drug use right outside the door. I know this is not the hotels fault, but it was really bad, just an fyi.

The room- we had a digital key confirmation for the 14th floor, that room was not available and we were put in a different room-  4  floors lower which we wanted to be higher up.

The lobby area is so crowded with people you can’t hardly get in the place. Every time we came in you couldn’t get in due to piles of luggage and people everywhere. The set up of the front desk is quite awkward-  not adequate for the number of people checking in and out- and lounging around in the lobby.

The toilet in the lobby is broken- wouldn’t flush.

The breakfast was so crowded you couldn’t get anything, and what was available was terrible. Fajita chicken for breakfast? Watered down luke-warm oatmeal, the serving things the lid fell off when you opened them. Watered down orange juice. Awkward set up for coffee service and again SO many people. There were no forks, nowhere to sit….

People said the rooftop bar was great- there is no rooftop bar. There is a terrace on the roof but there was nothing special about it.

The elevators were terribly slow. Even though our check out was extended the keys stopped working and we couldn’t get back upstairs and had to wait for almost 20 minutes because the line at the desk and one guy working. There was a second guy but he was not doing check ins or outs.
The room- was small even for NYC standards. 

The bathroom sink had no room for you to set a toiletries bag and you could not set it on the top of the toilet because the button to flush is there. 
The shower was small, the water pressure was good. 
The kitchen area was tiny and so close to the bed you could take stuff out of the fridge door from the bed. 
There were no glasses for the kitchen, and no large bowls (for chips/popcorn)- there were cereal bowls. There were no towels for use in the kitchen either, so you had to use a bath towel/rag if you needed to wash and dry something.
There are two bedside tables that are super tiny and I knocked everything off of the one next to my side every time I moved.
The couch is not fit to sit on, although we did use it a couple times to eat so we were not eating in the bed.
Ice makers only on every third floor.
The pillows… are garbage they need to throw those out and get new ones I mean come on this is a Hilton!
There is a mirror but you can’t “get ready” in front of it if you need to use a hair dryer or curling iron as there’s no plug.

The lighting was inadequate.
The TV does not have options for smart tv functions like Netflix or HULU not that we wanted to stay in and watch tv but there was a hockey game on that we missed because I couldn’t log in to my Hulu account. (We didn’t travel with laptops so we could hook up to the tv).
The bed itself was ok-  not comfortable if you’re used to a pillow top mattress. Pretty firm- had a hard time sleeping and I was so worn out from all the walking.

The view out the windows is an ugly building with zero view of any skyline or landmarks at all.  Just FYI if that’s important to you as you’re planning your trip. I don’t know if the view is any better higher up. We were put on the 10th floor which there is no view from there except into residents windows.

No light canceling window covers. There is a shade for night and a shade that keeps people across the street seeing in which you can leave down during the day if you need light.

Consistent noise from sirens and car horns all night.

I know some of these things are beyond the hotels control, but they were plenty of things that were within the hotels control that missed the mark for a Hilton brand. This location is good on the one has but not good on the other. NYC is getting back to the 90’s level of homelessness and drug abuse. People peeing on the sidewalk, we walked past people doing crack and shooting up, steps from the door of the hotel.

Overall I was very disappointed considering how much I paid for this room and I have a level of quality I expect from Hilton.

I would not say “avoid” this hotel as I am sure it fits the needs of some- but for me, I won’t stay there again. 

Had I been traveling alone it may have been better as far as how small it was-  two people trying to move around in there it was just too cramped. We were in a king suite. Too many other contributing factors make this a place I won’t stay again.

title: Great place to stay
text:
Service was great. Breakfast was pretty good.  Not always the same. We ejoyed  or stay and would definitely recommend it.
Staff was very friendly and very helpful.  We needed some more decafe coffee in the room.  It was furnished right away.

title: Best customer service experience
text:
Amazing customer service from the front desk. 
I forget his name (Mario or Marco?) was great. Even tapped into his days selling shoes to give me shoe recommendations for my kids. I will definitely stay at the family friendly hotel again.

title: Thank you Marco Perez!
text: We’re on a month long coast-to-coast family trip. Moving between hotels every 2-3 days. In all our travels we never met such an amazing, gracious and top notch desk manager as Marco Perez. He’s hospitality made us feel we’re at home among friends. Thank you Marco, you’re the best!

title: Convenient location and fits a family of 5!
text: Stayed here with our family of 5 over February break in the “oversized two queens with sofa bed” room. It’s rare to find a hotel for a family of 5 in Manhattan, so this was a great find. The room itself is small (as are all Manhattan rooms), but had 5 sleeping spaces and an efficiency kitchen. Breakfast is included, but be prepared to wait in line for a few minutes. Nor a luxurious hotel, but a great find for a family looking for a midrange hotel in the garmet district.

title: First time to New York
text: Check in made easy by great staff, they patiently allowed us to pay across 3 cards while we worked out the conversion of USD to AUD. Also we had booked for 7 nights but due to flight delays we didn’t arrive until the second day, we were charged early check in rather than the whole night which saved us money, much appreciated. The room was very clean, spacious and the kitchenette was a surprise although we didn’t use it. The housekeeping staff tidied our room and replaced towels every day. For us, the  hotel was in walking distance of everything we wanted to see. The only disappointing thing was in seven days of breakfast there wasn’t any bacon on the menu, however there was a lot of other choices both hot and cold and the fresh fruit options were great. The guest laundry was also an added bonus.

title: Awesome hotel experience
text: Mariana and Ana were amazing.  My little girls woke up early for pancakes which on the morning were not available.  I spoke to Mariana and she amazingly made it happen.  My little girls were so happy.  Thank Mariana and Ana for an excellent experience

title: Week-long visit first week of fall
text:
This was an excellent stay for an affordable price in midtown Manhattan. Check in was a bit busy at around 3pm and we waited for about a half hour to have the room ready in the lobby where they serve coffee and hot chocolate and small snacks all day. Excellent location of hotel, only a couple minutes walk to ACE trains, and a few extra minutes to 123 and NQRW trains. The room was clean and large for NYC standards, certainly leaving enough room for 2 to unpack both of our bags without getting in each other's way. We stayed in the King Premium Studio on the tenth floor that had windows out towards 37th street. The refrigerator did make an annoying whining noise occasionally but not enough to disrupt sleep. Could barely hear traffic from the room and could not at all hear other guests. The bed was  a bit uncomfortable and that  is probably because it likely being due for a replacement. At peak times the elevator did take some time and I managed to get stuck on it going in the wrong direction one morning, so the elevators definitely can be finicky. Housekeeping came daily for a turn-down make the bed and replace towels but you could ask for them to clean it like it was fresh the first day you got it if you give them a day heads up. We were there a week and didn't feel the need to have it super cleaned. Water pressure and temperature were great for the shower and sinks. Didn't use the stove or the microwave but we did run the dishwasher before we left with the dishes we used. Free breakfast every morning was wonderful but definitely crowded. Often times they had some version of eggs, meat and a vegetarian warm dish but also your typical continental breakfast items. I had done A LOT of research prior to booking this hotel and did so because this was the biggest room with a refrigerator in midtown for the best price (often times cheaper than hotels that didn't have a refrigerator in the room at all). The 22 floor rooftop area was a pretty great place to visit for sunset with a glass of whatever you BYOB.
Something we did notice after walking nearly 10 miles a day ALL over NYC exploring the different neighborhoods and everything is that the block that the hotel is on is in fact the most crowded with people struggling with mental illness and addiction. Which actually surprised us because we walked in all sorts of places and sure as sh*t, our block was the worst. Now that said, it wasn't anything where I feared for myself or anything. It can feel a little uncomfortable but just not making eye contact and moving along they didn't seem to deliberately bother anyone. I've worked as a nurse in mental health for over a decade and these individuals were not a threat to anyone but themselves.

title: Location is great but the service is better.
text: This hotel is known for its convenience but what it should be known is for their service. The staff is great, in particular Amanda. She was above and beyond helpful and always  pleasant and nice. The hotel is within walking distance of the Javits and Times Square, which is a plus. I can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Henry was super awesome, great location, clean and spacious rooms.
text: Henry Gray was super, super, super, super nice/professional/helpful/patient /accommodating awesome with all our questions and requests. All staff was super attentive. Breakfast area was SUPER clean. You could see all employees being polite, a tall younger Black gentleman held the elevator door open for me during breakfast time. Multiple staff members were taking care of the breakfast area. Good selections of options.  Rooms are spacious, love the kitchen even though we didn’t use, but we did use the big fridge. Cute rooftop, nice to get away.

title: Abuso por parte del hotel
text:
Lo primero que expongo en esta opinión que vamos de viaje mi mujer , una niña de 1 año y yo , primera impresión no fue buena al llegar con muchos vagabundos en la calle pinchando droga a la vista de todo el mundo , lo segundo el hotel en si están bien habitaciones y desayuno .

Lo siguiente opinión es la siguiente salimos mañana 9 octubre a las 22:00 , le pregunto al recepcionista que por La Niña que queremos salir sobre las 18:00 para no estar todo el día tirado con La Niña por la ciudad por tener el vuelo largo de New York hasta madrid, nosotros pensamos que era 70 o 80 dólares esas 5 horas y nos dicen que por quedarnos esas 5 horas son 250 dólares como si fuese una noche , me parece un abuso total por parte de hotel por eso dejo aquí mi comentario sobre el hotel .

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo!
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato presso questo hotel per 7 giorni a metà luglio 2022.

È situato in una posizione strategica nel quartiere Hell's Kitchen tra Hudson Yards ed a 10 minuti a piedi da Times Square. Da questa posizione si possono raggiungere in pochi minuti le fermate della metro Penn Station e Port Authority bus terminal. Nei pressi dell'hotel si trovano vari fast food ed all'angolo un Seven Eleven aperto 24h.

Gli ambienti interni della struttura si presentano bene, moderni e puliti.

In fase di prenotazione tramite Booking abbiamo richiesto una stanza che fosse il meno rumorosa possibile e senza alcuna remora ci è stato assegnato un alloggio che affacciava sul retro dell'edificio.

La stanza è ampia rispetto alla media, c'è un piccolo divano ed un angolo cucina attrezzato con piastre, microonde, frigo e freezer ma il vero punto di forza è il materasso, molto comodo. Anche il bagno e la doccia sono ampi.

L'hotel offre un servizio quotidiano di pulizia leggera mentre su richiesta, fatta il giorno prima, la pulizia è completa e vengono cambiati gli asciugamani.

Avevamo segnalato un piccolo problema alla tenda ed servizio di manutenzione è stato tempestivo.

Il personale alla reception è sempre stato molto gentile e disponibile.

La colazione compresa nel prezzo è a buffet, offre pietanze sia dolci che salate, pane con possibilità di tostarlo al momento, marmellatine, frutta fresca, secca, yogurt, muffins, ecc.

Nella hall è possibile usufriure di caffè ed acqua calda 24h gratuitamente inoltre è presente anche un minimarket interno con cibi e bevande.

Ai piani alti della struttura c'è una bella terrazza panoramica dalla quale si scorge il The Edge ed altri grattacieli famosi, da lassù ci si sente immersi nella città.

 

Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, se dovessi ritornare a New York la mia scelta ricadrà su questo hotel.

Lo consiglio vivamente!

title: They put the HOME in Homewood Suites
text: Lovely property and extraordinary staff. They fall over themselves finding ways to take care of you. Special thanks to Lenny and her incredible housekeeping staff-especially Vicky who took care of my floor. The rooms are well appointed and entire facility spotless. Just around the corner from great restaurants and a lovely coffee shop 3 doors down.

title: Buen hotel
text:
Es un hotel muy cómodo agradable con personal siempre dispuesto a ayudar , el sofá cama es muy incómodo para un adulto …con surte sirve para un niño pequeño .
Lamentablemente el entorno donde se encuentra hay muchos indigentes drogados que produce mucha inseguridad cada vez que uno ingresa al hotel .

title: Hidden Gem in NYC
text:
I've been to my fair share of NYC hotels over the years. I have to say, I wasn't entirely sure what to expect at the Homewood Suites in Manhattan but I was very pleased! The room was as roomy as any NYC hotel room and most importantly, IT WAS QUIET!!! Honestly, I never would have guessed I was in the heart of Midtown as I never heard a single siren or trash truck.

The location was great. It was super easy to get around to any location and we walked A LOT during our stay.

If you're looking for a great hotel, in a central location, at a reasonable NYC price, this is the one for you.

title: Consistently Excellent Service!
text: Although everyone at the hotel is helpful and customer service oriented, special shout out for Jonathan, Nick and Malik for consistently going above and beyond to make the guests stay a comfortable one!  Highly recommend the property for its location, services and superb customer service by the hotel staff!

title: Worst stay ever!
text: Gast wird nur als störend wahrgenommen und in das erst beste  Zimmer verfrachtet. Reklamationen prallen ab. Selbst als Diamond Member wird man nur seicht beschwichtigen ohne aber einen Finger für das Wohl des Kunden zu tun. Hard selling at it's best. Nie wieder!

title: Terrible Stay
text: Stayed for 3 nights.  During check in, no acknowledgement of Diamond HH status.  They ran out of bottled water.  They had coffee, tea & hot chocolate in the lobby, but ran out of hot water.  No upgrade available and despite profile indicating high floor away from elevator, we were assigned a room on the 3rd floor next to the elevator.  The room was already occupied by another party so we had to go back down and get a different room although it was on the same floor.  The bed in the room was very soft and squeaked every time we tossed or turned.  The hotel offers breakfast from 7:00 am to 10:00 am, but at 8:00 am the next morning, they were out of eggs and said they would not get any more until 9:00.  When we went back down, they were out of eggs and they said they were not making any more.  Tables in the breakfast area were wobbly.  My 64 year old wife got down on the floor to place paper under the legs so that the table would be stable.  The location is good - 3 blocks from Penn Station, but as mentioned by others, there are homeless on the sidewalk in front of the hotel.

title: A very comfortable nice stay
text: This is a very convenient hotel in NYC. The room was spacious with all useful features you need. It was very comfortable, quiet and clean. The staff were very helpful and polite. The location is excellent near many attractions and restaurants. A very good hot breakfast is served in the dining room. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: viaggio in famiglia
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso questa struttura a settembre 2022. L'albergo ha una posizione ottima, in pieno centro, vicino alla fermata della metro, alla stazione centrale dei treni e a quella dei bus. La struttura è ben tenuta, il personale gentile e disponibile. La camera era un pò piccola (forse perchè c'era anche un angolo cottura), ma pulita. Unico difetto, se ne vogliamo trovare, un rumore un pò fastidioso e abbastanza continuo (forse perchè eravamo vicino agli ascensori).
La colazione molto varia, con la possibilità di portare via del cibo dentro a contenitori forniti dallo stesso albergo. Colazione compresa nel prezzo.
L'hotel dispone anche di lavatrici ed asciugatrici (che abbiamo usato) ed anche di una palestra.
L'hotel dispone anche di una terrazza dalla quale si può ammirare un bel panorama.
Lo consiglio vivamente a chi vuole soggiornare a NY.

title: Excellent Stay - Thank You!
text:
We stayed for ten nights at Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan and had a most wonderful time in NY. 

Firstly, we highly appreciated the exceptional service!
The whole crew was incredibly nice and took very good care of us. We highly appreciated the pleasant and warm atmosphere (which we did not expected in busy NYC). From Henry, who helped us booking our New York Yankees tickets and explained all details to us; Giovanni, Winn and Jennifer who took very good care of us during check-in, check-out and all other wishes and questions we had during our stay. 
There was always someone (we think the managers) on the floor, who always made sure that everything was alright for us. All crew members (incl. house keeping, kitchen, staff…) have been incredibly friendly and there was a very positive team-vibe!
(We have not experienced this kind of service and vibe for a long time). Exceptional - Thank you!

About the room and hotel in general:
Perfect bath- and room-size with enough space for our clothes. Kitchen was well equipped to cook proper meals (incl. dishwasher and even washing-up liquid). High quality and very comfortable bed, linen and towels! The breakfast was beyond - a wide range of food and the possibility to pack lunch boxes!

The check-in and check-out were very smooth. We could leave our luggage on the day of our departure and booked the airport drop-off service (at a very good price).

Homewood Suites has some very nice features which we haven‘t really experienced before in a hotel and which are simply perfect for the kind of trips we love to take.
- Apartment rooms (with kitchen) incl. hotel comfort.
- Very good breakfast with the option for take away.
- Hot coffee and tea options all day.
- Gym, nice rooftop and little convenience shop in the lobby.
- Welcoming atmosphere and very kind crew (all crew-members: desk team, housekeeping and managers)

Thank you Homewood Suites-Crew for the perfect stay. We love to come back and will recommend Homewood Suites to family and friends. All the best for you and hopefully see you soon.

title: The best hotel
text:
Even before Covid, we don’t like to dine in restaurants and food court all the time while visiting nyc, but storing heating and eating take out food in the typical hotel room was always challenge, where there is at best a mini fridge, no utensils, no means to wash up.

With the threat of Covid still hanging over us, we decided to try this hotel which offers a kitchenette in each room. So far it has Far Exceeded all expectations.

Room and bathroom size are fine, but more importantly everything is well designed and very practical. Enough real drawer and wardrobe. All furniture aren’t chipped and scratches like in other Hilton chain hotels we’ve visited.

All kitchen and bathroom faucets are simple and smooth, no funny or over sized spouts. There are more hooks and towel bars in the bathroom, unlike all other Hilton chain hotels we’ve been to.

Good size perfect working fridge and freezer - no noise at night!

High quality clean hardwood floor throughout, clean stylish tiles all round the bathroom. 

All doors are solid wood doors, well painted, no wide gap letting through drafts and noise, none of those flimsy sliding ones letting through light and noise all around.

There are numerous lights all over the room, each separately controlled, so you can pick what feels perfect for you at any point in time.

Management and house keeping have been responsive and courteous.

I know some reviews complain about lack of full room service. The fact  is that the hotel does provide it every 4 days and more frequently upon request. At other times the level of limited service which is garbage removal and towel replenish, is actually all that we want. Anything more even feels intrusive sometimes.

Some reviewers were worried about the homeless population in the neighborhood. There is no denying that there are more of them than in most other parts of town, given the vicinity of the Port Authority Bus Terminal, Penn Station etc. but unless you stay in the upper west and upper east area, I suspect you will find them everywhere, including in the subway trains and all the subway stations. They are all smart enough to leave the general population and tourists alone, in exchange for being allowed to stay. While there are always a few mentally disturbed, there is always a large police presence.

As long as price stays within range for us, this will definitely be my top pick for visiting nyc going forward.

title: Fall Vacation
text:
We spent Eight nights here 9/20-9/28. Small, but  well designed room with a king sized bed and floor to ceiling windows. Functional mini kitchen. 
Breakfast was available each morning. A hot egg dish, a breakfast meat , potatoes along with various beads, yogurt , cereal, and hard boiled eggs . Coffee and tea is available all day ! This is a real benefit when you consider how expensive it can be to eat in NYC. 
Housekeeping is on request , but we were told they pull trash and replace towels each day , but that did not always happen. ( this is why I did not give 5 stars ) . They did respond to texts pretty promptly .
There is a roof top Terrace where we watched a thunder storm pass through , which was pretty cool! 
The site is very convenient to public transit.

title: Great location and tremendous customer service
text: Amazing customer service.  I had a mix up and forgot to extend my checkout date after my work trip needed me through the next morning.  Despite being sold out, the hotel notified me they could extend me another night. I was/am so thankful!  The rooms were perfect for me with a fridge, nice amenities, continental breakfast, and walking distance to my favorite Church 2 blocks down the street. I would stay here again in a minute.

title: Great location great service
text: Superb central location. Close to everywhere. Good well equipped clean rooms. Great customer service and a good buffet style breakfast to start the day. Good selection of breakfast items. This is a great choice for a trip to New York and with a family.

title: We recommend!
text: Excellent place to stay to tour NY. Walking distance to many sites, easily accessible to subway. Breakfast top-notch as far as included breakfasts go. Many employees working. Friendly staff. Room was great, very quiet.

title: Tres belle hôtel
text: Chambre supérieure avec vu sur la ville , très spacieuse pour 3 avec 2 grand lit, aucun bruit dans la nuit très bon insonorisation des fenêtres je le recommande , seul bémol salle des petits déjeuner trop petite et le ménage fait à la demande .

title: Excelente localização
text: A localização é excelente., os funcionários são muito atenciosos e profissionais.  O pequeno almoço embora pouco variado tinha o essencial. Tinha oferta de café a qualquer hora do dia e da noite.Permitaram deixar a mala após o check out sem cobrar nada.

title: Great service
text:
The hotel is great and the service is above all expectations!
Amanda was especially very useful. 
Definitely will be coming back with family and friends. 
Food, cleaning, everything was on point. Thanks!

title: NY Vacation
text: Stay was good. Convienient kitchenette to make something quick. Comfortable bed and a small sofa to work and lounge. Breakfast was a nice surprise. At the Lounge, Mr. Felix and Lizbeth were attentive and friendly.  Overall good stay.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Cuando se viaja a NY es imprescindible decidir una excelente ubicación debido a lo complejo que significa moverse en esta ciudad. Este hotel está a unos 10 mins caminando de la estación de metro más cercana, así como de la 5a Av. Tiene una terraza linda, se pueden apreciar las luces que tanto identifican a esta ciudad. 

El hotel es pequeño pero suficientemente cómodo si lo que se busca es un lugar solo para descansar. No tiene Room Service; el desayuno es casi malo; si no notificas con un día de anticipación que te hagan la habitación, no la hacen, pero no te lo dicen en el check in; ojalá en la terraza tuvieran servicio de bar, sobre todo considerando que no es tan recomendable salir tarde en esta ciudad con tantos drogadictos en todas las calles de la zona.

El servicio digamos que bueno a secas. Nada memorable, ni bueno ni malo.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Great service, check in no problem. Great Breakfast and employees, Felix was very nice to all of us! The location is perfect, walkable distance to a lot of places in NY.  We would stay there again!  The rooftop  was very nice and quiet and has a great view!

title: Excellent stay at Hilton Garden Inn
text: Win , Douglas, and Priscilla are just super amazing and helpful. Check in was efficient and the room was comfortable and quiet. The location was wonderful. It made my NY experience absolutely fabulous. Can’t wait to come back.

A very nice anx accommodating to our changes- nice and friendly staff. Everything very clean and located to everything we needed. Can’t wait to visit again! Shoutout to Win for helping us with our needs.

title: A good base for New York.
text:
Check in no problem, although we had made some requests by email a week before our stay but unfortunately neither were actioned! Our room which we were initially given unfortunately had a very strong marijuana smell (which is legal in NYC), but credit to the hotel they moved us straight away. 
Breakfast was good always a variety with the French toast my personal favourite, house keeping was ok with light touch everyday clean towels etc, you can ask for a full clean anytime if you want as we did for one day but unfortunately wasn’t done but was sorted the next day when requested again. As mentioned in previous reviews there are a few drug/ homeless around the hotel area as there are around New York anyway but they never bothered you and there is not much the hotel can do about it. All the staff from front of house, breakfast staff & cleaners all work hard and made you feel welcome.

title: Gran ubicación pero es un 3 estrellas con precios de 4.
